conclusion: Analyze the system's behavior under different conditions to determine the maximum possible distance L_2.
Determine the initial pressure in the cylinder when the elevator is stationary.
The initial pressure P_1 in the cylinder is calculated as 9 x 10^4 Pa.
Determine the volume of the gas when the elevator is stationary.
The volume of the gas V_1 is calculated as 570 x 10^-6 m^3.
Determine the maximum acceleration of the elevator.
The maximum acceleration a of the elevator is calculated as 6 m/s^2.
Determine the new pressure in the cylinder when the elevator accelerates upwards.
The new pressure P_2 in the cylinder is calculated as 8.4 x 10^4 Pa.
